bioghist.p: Jacob R. Elfreth (1789-1870) was a Philadelphia Quaker who compiled the Elfreth Book of Letters, a series of writings by his children. He was one of the earliest students at Westtown School. Joseph Elfreth (b. 1824), the oldest of Jacob's children, was apprenticed to a linen merchant in 1840, but did not remain in that line of work long. He moved to Haddonfield, New Jersey, in 1852, where he married Hannah Hill and worked as a salesman. Another member of the family, Florence H. Elfreth, married Samuel Bispham Redman in 1875.

scopecontent.p: This is a miscellaneous collection of materials related to the Elfreth family. Materials include: letters to and from Joseph Elfreth; financial journals, records of deaths, and weather observations of Jacob R. Elfreth; letters of Joseph Mendenhall to Florence Redman (1892-1903); receipts and insurance policies; and newspaper clippings.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
